descriptionProfile: National Geographic photojournalists harnessing the power of visual storytelling to scale solutions for women and girls globally.
National Geographic photojournalists harnessing the power of visual storytelling to scale solutions for women and girls globally.

posts.description: Julieth Mollel is proud to say that she is a Solar Sister entrepreneur, and her success in selling the lanterns and cookstoves has given her hope for herself and the future of her family. Until she started work with Solar Sister, life was almost unbearable for Julieth. She would breathe in lots of smoke from her dirty cooking fire each time she cooked. She started to have severe pains in her chest that prevented her from making the grueling trek to collect firewood. She took a position with Solar Sister in 2013 and hasn't looked back. Her chest pains have subsided and with her new income, she's able to ensure her grandchildren will receive a good education. She's never given up on her family and she's our #WCW // Photo by @joannapinneo | @rippleeffectimages #Tanzania #Solarsister #photography #portrait #humans #africa #womenandgirls #health #solar #conservation

In any climate disaster, 70% of the victims are women. The burden of safeguarding children and social inequality leave women in a more vulnerable position when disaster strikes. Photo by @amivitale | @rippleeffectimages #Bangladesh #photography #climate #women #globalwarming #water #color

Mary Okeyo embodies the ideal of the Good Samaritan. Every day she visits the neglected in Kenya to distribute food, pain medicine, and intimate care for women who have been largely forgotten. Her dedication to altruism is a blessing to her community, and it's what makes her our #WCW // Photo by @ljohnphoto | @rippleeffectimages #Kenya #photography #health #womenandgirls #humans #kindness #good #inspiring #smile

Chintan offers security and dignity to India's community of wastepickers, who are too often endangered and discriminated against. An organization and a uniform gives these hardworking folk purpose, identity, and most importantly a paycheck. Photo by @ljohnphoto | @rippleeffectimages #India #photography #green #color #humans #Chintan

The human toll of Household Air Pollution is immense. 4.3 million people die from its effects each year, even though it's entirely preventable. Through clean cooking practices, solar lights, and household safety, we can completely eliminate it. Photo by @ljohnphoto | @rippleeffectimages #Guatemala #photography #funeral #humans #health #HAP

Maharani Hemlata Rajye is Indian nobility, a member of the House of Marwar. Despite her noble stature, she's committed to helping the people of the Thar desert region, and sits on the board of the Jal Bhagirathi Foundation. Jal Bhagirathi helps to provide these communities with the resources and training they need to preserve water and maintain hygiene. Rajye uses her influence for good, and she's our #WCW // Photo by @ljohnphoto | @rippleeffectimages #India #jalbhagirathi #humans #womenandgirls #water #photography #

Today's #WCW comes from Ripple Photographer @ljohnphoto, who just received a fantastic Sony grant to cover new programs in Cambodia! Isidora has always believed in the power of education, even though she only finished the 6th grade. So it is no surprise that she finds herself teaching and motivating others in her village to do whatever they can to improve their lives. Though the village has been involved in reforestation projects for the past 17 years it is their relationship with El Porvenir that is bringing benefits like new stoves and better sanitation. Isidora is a leader, an innovator, and she's our #WCW // Photo by @ljohnphoto | @rippleeffectimages #Nicaragua #Elporvenir #photography #womenandgirls #portrait #human

Exciting news! We've partnered with @sony to cover two incredible programs in Cambodia this fall! We'll be shining a light on the amazing work of @operationasha and People Improvement Organization (PIO). Thanks and congratulations to @thephotosociety and the other grantees! Photo by @anniegriffithsphotography | @rippleeffectimages #Cambodia #photography #goodnews #people #humans #smile #sony #thephotosociety

Ritha Mollel has high aspirations. She's just graduated primary school and is getting ready for her secondary school exams. One day she hopes to be a scientist. But without her grandmother's income from Solar Sister, Ritha's family wouldn't be able to afford the school fees. Thankfully their program (and her grandmother's hard work) means that Ritha will be able to pursue education to her heart's content. Photo by @joannapinneo | @rippleeffectimages #Tanzania #photography #portrait #Africa #education #womenandgirls #solarsister

Augustina Lopez lives with her daughter and granddaughter in a simple Guatemalan home. They support themselves by weaving traditional cloth, but would have to put up with constant smoke from their communal cooking fire. Thanks to @stoveteam, they were provided with a clean cookstove that will protect them from the harmful effects of HAP. Augustina's perseverance and love for her family make her our #WCW // Photo by @ljohnphoto | @rippleeffectimages #Guatemala #photography #womenandgirls #humans #love
